definition: to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: I have get a paper-clip. Will that do?
sentences.chinese: 我有一个曲别针。能行吗？

sentences.english: They also include plans for clip-on ties.
From the tiny tin pin, the spinner pinched off an inch.
sentences.chinese: 纺纱工从小锡制别针上掐掉一英寸。

sentences.english: Rhodium-plated brooch with entwined clear crystal pavé loops.
sentences.chinese: 铑被镀的别针与被纠缠的清楚水晶铺圈。

sentences.english: Or try sliding the pencil close to the heavier clip.
sentences.chinese: 或许可以试着将铅笔向重的曲别针一边滑动。

sentences.english: If there were no limb on the number of ejector pins.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有在喷射器别针的数量的肢体。

sentences.english: Pin the pieces together before sewing them.
sentences.chinese: 把布片用别针别在一起，然后再缝起来。

sentences.english: Don't button up brooch on the silk clothing, otherwise leave pinprick easily.
sentences.chinese: 勿在丝绸服装上扣别针，否则易留下针眼。

sentences.english: Doctors had fixed it in place with metal pins.
sentences.chinese: 医生用金属别针将它安了回去。

sentences.english: From the tiny tin pin, the  spinner pinched off an inch.
sentences.chinese: 纺纱工从小锡别针上掐掉一英寸。

sentences.english: He wore a pearl pin stuck in his black tie.
sentences.chinese: 他那黑领带上别著一个珍珠别针。

sentences.english: I let her wear my guardian angel pin to help keep her safe.
sentences.chinese: 我让她戴上了我的保卫天神别针，来包管她的安定。

sentences.english: The letters were held together with a paper clip.
sentences.chinese: 这些信是用一枚曲别针夹在一齐的。

sentences.english: I have got a paper - clip .
Use the tape to fix the pin to the camera's lens.
sentences.chinese: 使用带子把别针安装到照像机的透镜上。

sentences.english: A  brooch fixed to the collar matched her diamond- studded  sapphire button earrings.
sentences.chinese: 领口一只别针，与碎钻镶蓝宝石的‘纽扣’耳环成套。

definition: a buckle or fastener for clothing that does not use a button and buttonhole (e.g. the buckle on metal wristwatches)
